intro: Campanula scheuchzeri subf. kerneri, commonly known as the Alpine bellflower, is a rare and striking plant native to high-altitude regions of the Alps. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine meadows, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine, fuzzy texture, aiding in water retention. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
